q: Which material is better for flood barriers—aluminum or steel?
a: Aluminum offers superior corrosion resistance and lighter weight (⅓ steel density). Steel provides higher stiffness for tall walls > 6 ft. Choice depends on span and exposure. For homes < 5 ft flood height, aluminum is preferred.

q: How does cost compare between aluminum and steel barriers?
a: Steel averages 20–25 % cheaper per sq ft but requires galvanizing and repainting. Aluminum's lower maintenance offsets higher initial cost after 5 years.

q: Which material performs better under impact loads?
a: Steel has 2× impact resistance, making it ideal for vehicular barriers. Aluminum deflects elastically but returns to shape under design limits.

q: Do both materials meet FEMA standards?
a: Yes—both can be engineered to ASCE 24 and FEMA TB-3 standards with proper coatings and documentation.
